alert.note: Alert for Adair; Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:42AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Franklin, Crawford, northern Sebastian, northeastern Haskell, Sequoyah, southeastern Adair and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1042 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Rudy to Tamaha. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Lavaca... Arkoma... Mulberry... Vian... Dyer... Bonanza... Gans... Tamaha... Moffett... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 27. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 296 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
